screen_desc: The screenshot shows the 'Settings' menu of a calendar or scheduling application, where different types of calendar events can be toggled on or off. The categories include "Events from Gmail," "Events," "Tasks," and "Reminders" under a General section, with toggles set to the on position, indicated by the blue color. Additionally, "Birthdays" and "Holidays" are listed under a More section with their toggles also turned on, indicated by the green color. The email address associated with these settings appears at the top of the list, suggesting these settings could be specific to that account. The top of the screen indicates it is 4:06 PM and shows standard smartphone connectivity icons.

Looking at the screenshot, the best way to proceed would be to exit the current settings menu of the calendar or scheduling application. This can usually be done by clicking the back button in the upper left-hand corner or by using the system navigation buttons.
action_plan: Click the back button on the top left of the screen or the system back button to return to the previous screen until reaching the home screen or app drawer.
